alert.note: Alert for Pike; Walthall (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 23 at 8:53PM CDT until March 25 at 4:22AM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Mississippi... Bogue Chitto River Near Tylertown affecting Pike and Walthall Counties. For the Bogue Chitto River...including Tylertown, Franklinton, Bush...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Bogue Chitto River Near Tylertown. * WHEN...Until early Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Travel in Hidden Springs Resort is possible but hazardous, as roads will be flooded. Evacuation of the park is recommended, when further rises are expected. Low-lying farm and pasture land near the river will remain flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 16.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:45 PM CDT Wednesday was 16.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 16.9 feet tomorrow morning. The river is expected to fall below flood stage late tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.0 feet on 11/16/1957. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lix. Click on the Rivers and Lakes menu for forecasts and observations. The next statement will be issued when updates are needed.
